earth/dust/clay/local/indigenous/crude opium/unsophisticated/one of the eight categories of ancient musical instruments 八音[ba1 yin1]
to change or replace/to experience/one of the five two-hour periods into which the night was formerly divided/watch (e.g. of a sentry or guard)

sentences.english: He has black short hair and big eyes.
sentences.chinese: 他有黑色短頭髮和大激埂篙簧蕻毫戈桐恭昆眼睛。

sentences.english: The invention provides an agricultural machine, in particular a mountain terracing machine.
sentences.chinese: 本發明提供一種農業機械，一種山地埂行機。

sentences.english: The measure of borders protected by plants can put less input but receive quick benefits.
sentences.chinese: 在埂坎上採取植物防護措施投入少，見效快。

sentences.english: Low banks of earth in the field turn it into many square sections.
sentences.chinese: 田裏的地埂把這片農田分成了很多正方形小塊。

sentences.english: She choked up when she began to talk about her mother.
sentences.chinese: 她開始談起母親時，便埂嚥着說不出話來。

sentences.english: Dave: The less I eat, the fatter I get.
sentences.chinese: 埂我喫鐵得霹越憫少，仿反滇而越胖。

sentences.english: He was herding pigs on the dam behind the village and came to me seeing I was at home.
sentences.chinese: 他在村後的壩埂上放豬，看到我在家，就來和我說話。

definition: earth embankment used to hold back or retain water/dike around a paddy field
strip of high ground/low earth dyke separating fields
ridge between fields/row of crops/grave mound/old variant of 壟|垄
(dialect) earthen dyke in a river or rice paddy (for irrigation purposes)
small plot of farm land/Taiwan pr. [xi1]
